meanings.definition: Treads: the part of a tire or shoe that makes contact with the ground
meanings.sent1: The treads on my sneakers help me walk safely on slippery surfaces.
meanings.sent2: The tire treads on the car were worn out and needed replacement.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on gum, and now the treads of my shoe are sticky!
meanings.sent4: Her shoes left intricate treads in the fresh snow as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The muddy treads on the floor indicated someone had been tracking dirt inside.

meanings.definition: Treads: walks in a specified way
meanings.sent1: He treads carefully through the dark forest, trying not to make a sound.
meanings.sent2: She treads lightly on the wooden floor to avoid waking up the baby.
meanings.sent3: The cat treads playfully around the room, chasing after a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His heart treads heavily as he approaches the podium to give a speech.
meanings.sent5: The dancer treads gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: Treads: the horizontal part of a step in a staircase
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to slip on the wet treads of the staircase.
meanings.sent2: The wooden treads of the old staircase creaked under his weight.
meanings.sent3: She sat on the top tread of the staircase, lost in thought.
meanings.sent4: The cat perched itself comfortably on the stair tread, observing the room.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out treads of the staircase needed to be replaced for safety reasons.
